hs_email_text: Beth and Kevin, attached is the detailed implementation plan from yesterday's session. 9-week timeline with go-live August 1. Key milestones and resource requirements on page 2. Please review and confirm so we can lock in our implementation team.

Marcus, great call yesterday. Marcus, great meeting yesterday with your leadership team. Attached is the finalized business case document with the agreed-upon assumptions. Next steps on our side: (1) draft MSA and send to your legal, (2) begin sensor specification for your Engel machines. Looking forward to getting started!

Marcus, thanks for the update. Glad the CEO approved. I've reviewed the MSA redlines from your legal team — all reasonable. Our counsel will have a clean version back to you by Monday. We're targeting June signatures with a July implementation kickoff. Almost there!

Dave, enjoyed our conversation yesterday. Attached is our solution brief specifically covering hydraulic press monitoring — seal wear detection, valve degradation tracking, and the 72-hour predictive failure window. Also included a case study from a stamping operation with similar Schuler presses. Demo link enclosed.

Dave, following up on the technical deep-dive. Attached is a pilot proposal for 10 presses across your two facilities. The pilot includes full sensor installation, 90 days of monitoring, and a detailed ROI report at the end. If the pilot validates, we'd expand to all 40+ presses in Phase 2.

Lisa, great connecting yesterday. I understand the urgency with your new packaging line arriving in August. Lisa, thanks for the call yesterday. Updated proposal attached reflecting the expanded scope to include palletizing integration. The revised quote is $75K for the full package. Timeline remains on track for your August line arrival. Let me know if you'd like to move forward with a site assessment.
